title: Three Hills fund buys £10m stake in Genius Sports
text:

Sat, Oct 3, 2015, 19:30 BST - UK Markets closed Three Hills fund buys £10m stake in Genius Sports By Elizabeth Anderson | Telegraph – 13 minutes ago -12.00 
The London-based private equity company bets big on sports gaming 
Three Hills Capital Partners, the private equity fund behind premium burger chain Byron, has invested £10m in Genius Sports, a London-based group that develops software used by bookmakers and lottery operators across the world. 
The investment is a combination of debt and equity, and gives the fund a minority stake of 5pc in the business. 
Three Hills was founded two years ago by Mauro Moretti, an investment veteran who is on the board of Wellington boot manufacturer Hunter. His portfolio also includes software company Dedalus and Aquafil, which produces polyester fibres for textile flooring and clothing. 
The investment will be used to fund further acquisitions. Genius Sports owns a collection of technology subsidiaries. One of them, Betgenius, provides software to betting operators including the gaming arm of Sky (LSE: BSY.L - news ) . 
“E-sports is a phenomenal growth area at the moment. There’s also a lot of growth in lottery sectors,” said Mark Locke, co-founder of Genius Sports. 
He added that the company, which had a turnover of £16m last year, is targeting growth in emerging markets (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) .
